page.title: 14LION HOUSE
page.content: MAFF stands for Ministry of Agriculture, Fisheries and Food. It is at Lion House and gives information to farmers. They have an HQ in White Hall, London. They have a publications department full of information on animals. Lion House was opened on 8 August 1968 by Sir Basil Engholm. It has been running for 17 years and it has 66 staff. Staff who travel around England used to send their travel claims to Guildford but now they send them to Lion House. Department Five handles animal care and diseases. Mostly they go down to farms to check the animals to make sure they aren't ill. In the publications department people do the printing. They have lots of leaflets _ at least 2000 of them in a room. They use computers to check the number of leaflets once a year.
